question: Most common lymphoma associated with Sicca syndrome is -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., MALToma o The most common histologic subtype of non-Hodgkin lymphoma in Sjogren syndrome is mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT) lymphoma, which can develop in any non-lymphoid tissue infiltrated by periepithelial lymphoid tissue-most commonly the salivary' glands, but also the stomach, nasopharynx, skin, liver, kidneys, and lungs.
